name: Alberto Zayas
description: '''Alberto Zayas Govín'''{{refn|group=nb|He is mistakenly referred to as '''Alfredo''' or '''Alfredito Zayas''' in some accounts and releases.<ref name="Diaz">{{cite web|last1=Díaz Ayala|first1=Cristóbal|title=Grupo Afrocubano Lulú Yonkori|url=http://latinpop.fiu.edu/SECCION01A.pdf|website=Encyclopedic Discography of Cuban Music 1925-1960|publisher=Florida International University Libraries|accessdate=May 26, 2015|date=Fall 2013}}</ref>}} (February 14, 1908 – 1983) was a [[Cuban rumba]] singer and songwriter who founded one of the first recorded rumba ensembles, Grupo Afrocubano Lulú Yonkori. He is considered one of the most important [[guaguancó]] vocalists/composers in the history of rumba.
